clinical_study.brief_title: Roxadustat for Anemia in Patients With CKD
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Cohort Study of Roxadustat for Anemia in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease

brief_summary.textblock: A number of RCT studies have shown the safety and effectiveness of oral Roxadustat in the treatment of renal anemia, but there is a lack of evidence from cohort studies. A prospective cohort study is planed to conduct to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Roxadustat for renal anemia in the real world.

detailed_description.textblock: The prevalence of anemia in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) (15.4%) is twice that of the general population (7.6%), and the degree of anemia increases with the severity of CKD. A number of RCT studies have shown the safety and effectiveness of oral Roxadustat in the treatment of renal anemia, but there is a lack of evidence from cohort studies. A prospective cohort study is planed to conduct to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Roxadustat for renal anemia in the real world. It is planned to continuously recruit patients with renal anemia in Shenzhen Second People's Hospital from October 2020 to June 2023. The treatment of anemia will be recorded (Roxadustat or erythropoietin), and the observation period is one year. Collect the patient's demographic characteristics, drug dosage, adjustment plan, hemoglobin. The main outcome indicators were: the average change in Hb from baseline to 28-52 weeks, and the Hb response rate reached during two consecutive visits; the secondary outcome indicators were: the maintenance rate of the target Hb level, iron metabolism indicators, 0 to 8 weeks of Hb level increase rate, dose adjustment and safety indicators. The generalized additive mixed model of repeated measures was used to analyze the changes and differences of outcome indicators in different groups. Expected results: In the cohort study, the effectiveness and safety of roxastat in the treatment of renal anemia, the starting dose and the adjustment plan, provide a basis for guiding the clinical safe and effective application of roxastat.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean value of Hb levels over time
primary_outcome.description: Hb will be measured throughout the period.

primary_outcome.measure: Achievement rate for target Hb level
primary_outcome.description: Percent of participants who achieved target Hb level (≥10.0 ).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Hb levels at 4 weeks after using roxadustat
secondary_outcome.description: Hb levels at 4 weeks after using roxadustat

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Hb levels at 8 weeks after using roxadustat
secondary_outcome.description: Hb levels at 8 weeks after using roxadustat
the dose of Roxadustat used recorded monthly

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Hemoglobin (Hb) levels
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Hemoglobin (Hb) levels was recorded monthly

secondary_outcome.measure: the proportion of patients with different Hb levels
secondary_outcome.description: the proportion of patients with different Hb levels

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients with low response to ESA
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with low response to ESA
Serum iron will be measured throughout the period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: adverse events will be record throughout the period.

study_pop.textblock: Renal anemia patients who are naïve to roxadustat or ESA
